title.narrative: Marine Turtle Conservation Fund

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to develop a hawksbill conservation program at Principe. Under this Award the Recipient will initially train local inhabitants to assist with turtle protection and research on local nesting beaches and foraging grounds and will conduct environmental outreach with local communities.

description.narrative: The recipient will implement community/National Park team patrols on main nesting beaches within the National Park to conduct standardized surveys and protect nests and nesting females according to prepared surveillance plan; select and train community members for beach patrol teams; and conduct education and outreach programs in local communities, schools and with artisianal fishers.

title.narrative: WILDLIFE LAW ENFORCEMENT IN GUINEA - GALF (Guine-Application de la Loi sur la Faune)

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to assist the government of Guinea to increase wildlife law enforcement capacity, produce effective deterrents to the killing of elephant and other threatened wildlife, and monitor the illegtal wildlife trade and other activities detrimental to ape survival. The recipient will identify large-scale dealers in ivory and meat and provide evidence to support legal action against them; bring about the arrest of large-scale illegal wildlife traders; ensure the prosecution of large-scale illegal wildlife traders, and raise public awareness of the increased enforcement of wildlife alw and the risks and peanlties for wildlife criminals.

title.narrative: Great Apes Conservation Fund

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to support the development of the Chimpanzee Conservation Center by building capacity, strengthening local engagement, and conducting chimpanzee monitoring. The recipient will hire a protection supervisor and train a local protection manager; ensure the protection of the northern portion of the PNHN; continue to promote coordination among government and park authorities to harmonize law enforcement efforts; ensure that the PNHN newly trained eco-guards are strategically placed in and around the PNHN; and conduct a survey of the CCC release site in the PNHN with local and international partners to guide protection efforts.

description.narrative: The recipient will provide technical support to MTCA funded projects in Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, Republic of Congo, Ivory Coast, Sao Tome and Principe, as well as conduct conservation programs and research in Corisco Bay as described in the proposal and conduct hawksbill and olive ridely genetics research focused on the Gulf of Guinea.The USFWS will work closely with grantee in setting priorities for project site visits, and developing budgets, and will also provide assistance as needed and requested in engaging with National Governmental and other institutions to improve collaboration and conservation outcomes.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Landscape Conservation for chimpanzees in the Bafing River Area

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to contribute to the conservation of the largest chimpanzee population in Guinea and West Africa through species and habitat protection. Specific activities include: (1) informing and educating key Guinean authorities and local communities about the importance of classified forests and plans to update the boundaries of the classified forests within the Foutah Djallon-Bafing Area critical to chimpanzee conservation; (2) working with key stakeholders to delimit and make visible the boundaries of the classified forests.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Landscape Conservation for chimpanzees in the Bafing River Area

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to contribute to the conservation of the largest chimpanzee population in Guinea and West Africa through species and habitat protection. Specific activities include: (1) informing and educating key Guinean authorities and local communities about the importance of classified forests and plans to update the boundaries of the classified forests within the Foutah Djallon-Bafing Area critical to chimpanzee conservation; (2) working with key stakeholders to delimit and make visible the boundaries of the classified forests.

title.narrative: Monitoring and conservation of the West African Green Turtle population outside the Poilo Island.hotspot.

description.narrative: The recipient will establish community based survey teams to survey sea turtle nesting beaches in southern Mauritania and Katrack Island, Guinea and continue working with artisanal fisherman to assess sea turtle bycatch along the Mauritanian coast.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Landscape conservation of chimpanzees in the Bafing River area, Guinea

description.narrative: The purpose of this 1-year project is to continue the process of creating the Moyen-Bafing National Park (MBNP) in Guinea in order to protect the largest remaining population of western chimpanzees and their habitat. Specific activities include: 1) in consultation with communities, forming a stakeholder committee and leading regional and national stakeholder meetings; 2) physically delimiting the proposed MBNP boundaries; 3) conducting a socio-economic study to inform future park management; and 4) initiating re-forestation of key areas of the proposed park.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Landscape conservation of western chimpanzees in the Moyen-Bafing National Park, Guinea

description.narrative: The purpose of this 1-year project is to protect the largest population of critically endangered western chimpanzees by completing the process of establishing the proposed Moyen-Bafing National Park. Activities include: 1) strengthening the involvement, and building the capacity, of surrounding communities in protection of the park and its natural resources; 2) creating local committees to facilitate regional and local stakeholder consultations; 3) implementing eco-friendly agricultural practices; 4) conducting participatory mapping missions to identify the community boundaries and to cultivate community support; 5) monitoring chimpanzee populations; 6) determining baseline land cover data; 7) implementing habitat regeneration and reforestation measures to maintain headwaters integrity; and 8) studying the effects of seasonal fires on the parks habitat.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Agency for International Development, Development Assistance

title.narrative: GALF Project / WARA NGO - The EAGLE Network Wildlife Law Enforcement in Guinea

description.narrative: The purpose of this 1-year project is to support conservation of great apes and other key species by supporting the Guinean legal systems ability to enforce the nations wildlife laws through conducting investigations, arrests, legal follow-up, and leveraging media exposure, in collaboration with national law enforcement authorities. Activities include: 1) operating an investigative network to obtain intelligence, identify targets and plan operations against major wildlife criminals; 2) assembling an operations team and providing on-the-job training to national law enforcement authorities; 3) assisting the team in conducting operations, arresting suspects, and channeling written statements to the courts; 4) supervising and assisting writing of legal statements against suspects; 5) promoting good governance in court procedures by educating legal system administrators; 6) assisting legal representation through legal analysis and advice, and support of lawyers fees; 7) ensuring prison sentences are served by conducting weekly jail monitoring visits; 8) working with court bailiffs to ensure awarded damages are paid; and 9) providing a deterrent to other potential offenders by leveraging media coverage of legal proceedings and successful law enforcement activities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Agency for International Development, Development Assistance

title.narrative: The Chimpanzee Conservation Center Release Project: An efficient tool for the conservation of verus chimpanzees in Guinea

description.narrative: The purpose of this 2-year project is to continue to protect the Haut Niger National Park and its wildlife. Specific activities include: 1) reinforcing local capacity to effectively and sustainably protect the Northern area of the park; 2) promoting coordination among government agencies to strengthen local engagement and homogenize law enforcement efforts to combat illegal resource extraction and chimpanzee pet trade; 3) increasing community education efforts in the Northern part of the park; and 4) identifying another release site to protect other chimpanzee habitat in Guinea.

title.narrative: PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION OF WESTERN CHIMPANZEES IN THE HAUT NIGER NATIONAL PARK, GUINEA.

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REDUCE THE RAPID INCREASE OF THREATS TO WESTERN CHIMPANZEE POPULATIONS AND OTHER BIODIVERSITY IN HAUT NIGER NATIONAL PARK, GUINEA BY 1 PROTECTING RELEASED AND FREE-RANGING CHIMPANZEES, AND MINIMIZING HUMAN-CHIMPANZEE CONTACT, THROUGH PHYSICAL STAFF PRESENCE AND ACTIVE MONITORING 2 EXPANDING AN ONGOING CAMERA TRAP PROJECT TO COVER 100 OF THE PARK S MAFOU CORE AREA 3 INCREASING AWARENESS AND SUPPORT FOR CHIMPANZEE CONSERVATION BY DISSEMINATING CAMERA TRAP DATA IN SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS AND TO LOCAL COMMUNITIES, EXPANDING THE EDUCATION FOR CONSERVATION PROGRAM, AND AIRING EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING ON LOCAL RADIO 4 REDUCING ANTHROPOGENIC PRESSURES ON THE PARK BY APPLYING RESULTS OF A SOCIOECONOMIC STUDY TO GUIDE DEVELOPMENT OF ALTERNATIVE LIVELIHOODS ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS BEEKEEPING.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION OF WESTERN CHIMPANZEES IN THE HAUT NIGER NATIONAL PARK, GUINEA.

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to reduce the rapid increase of threats to Western chimpanzee populations and other biodiversity in.Haut Niger National Park, Guinea by (1) protecting released and free-ranging chimpanzees, and minimizing human-chimpanzee.contact, through physical staff presence and active monitoring; (2) expanding an ongoing camera trap project to cover 100% of.the parks Mafou core area; (3) increasing awareness and support for chimpanzee conservation by disseminating camera trap data.in scientific publications and to local communities, expanding the Education for Conservation Program, and airing educational.programming on local radio; (4) reducing anthropogenic pressures on the park by applying results of a socioeconomic study to.guide development of alternative livelihoods activities, such as beekeeping.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: CHIMPANZEE CONSERVATION IN THE MOYEN-BAFING AND BADIAR LANDSCAPE, GUINEA

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE STRENGTHENING OF HABITAT CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN THE MOYEN BAFING AND BADIAR NATIONAL PARKS TO IMPROVE CONDITIONS FOR WEST AFRICAN CHIMPANZEES BY (1) INCREASING INVOLVEMENT OF LOCAL POPULATIONS IN THE SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES COMMUNICATIONS, STRENGTHENING LOCAL GOVERNANCE STRUCTURES, AND IMPLEMENTING PARTICIPATIVE CORRIDOR BOUNDARY IDENTIFICATION AND (2) RESTORING HABITAT CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN IDENTIFIED CHIMPANZEE HOTSPOTS IN THE MOYEN BAFING AND BADIAR NATIONAL PARKS LANDSCAPE THROUGH CAMERA TRAP MONITORING OF CHIMPANZEES, ESTABLISHING LAND COVER AND LAND USE BASELINE DATA, REHABILITATING KEY FOREST HABITATS THROUGH NATURAL REGENERATION, AND ESTABLISHING FIREBREAKS AND A FIRE MANAGEMENT PLAN TO ACCELERATE THE REESTABLISHMENT OF DEGRADED HABITAT.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: CHIMPANZEE CONSERVATION IN THE MOYEN-BAFING AND BADIAR LANDSCAPE, GUINEA

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to support the strengthening of habitat connectivity between the Moyen.Bafing and Badiar National Parks to improve conditions for West African chimpanzees by: (1) increasing.involvement of local populations in the sustainable management of natural resources communications,.strengthening local governance structures, and implementing participative corridor boundary.identification; and (2) restoring habitat connectivity between identified chimpanzee hotspots in the.Moyen-Bafing and Badiar National Parks landscape through camera-trap monitoring of chimpanzees,.establishing land cover and land use baseline data, rehabilitating key forest habitats through natural.regeneration, and establishing firebreaks and a fire management plan to accelerate the reestablishment of.degraded habitat.
